author: {'steamid': '76561198340121315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1706484482}
review: This is a kid's game, probably good for ages 8-12. I bought it for my 6-year-old, who loved it but often required me sitting next to her to help her figure out what to do next. Once we got the hang of it, she played through each level at her own speed, then she watched me earn 3 stars for completing it quickly. There are 49 levels. This game is G rated - there are goblins that knock out your workers, but they are smiling and carrying musical instruments the whole time. Most levels, there is no way to get stuck and no way to lose. The game can be completed without going quickly and earning stars, but to get all achievements you have to be fast and efficient. The last third of the game is very repetitive with almost nothing new, so good for kids but boring for adults.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1706869426}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
Hum... It's OK. This is a Time Management game with a fantasy theme. The graphics are decent. OK music. The story is just a lazy "tale".

No bugs or crashes. 

Now, this is just another game like any other game like this, nothing is new or original. If you like this type of time-waster you gonna be entertained. It includes cards and easy-to-get achievements. Cheap when on sale and long enough for the price. Yeah... Why not?

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1685893995}
review:
Gnomes Garden is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as if it was a real PC game (it's not)... it's a cash grab from greedy mobile devs.  The game is a pointless "12 Labours of Hercules" screen tapper/clicker mobile app.  There's no gameplay, just tapping on the screen.  The mobile app is made to look like you're making interesting decisions as you're presented with a map of a town/village/pathway that has you clicking on various things to collect things which are then consumed when you click on an obstacle, which unlocks more things to click on.  This is so lame and shallow, you could write a script to randomly click the screen and given enough time, it would beat the game.

The shady developer behind this valueless shovelware has proven to be a persistent nuisance abusing Steam Direct... they've dumped over a hundred valueless mobile app tier asset flips onto Steam, many featuring plagiarised/stolen stock art and other unethical, shady behaviours. 

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this particular game, with minor reskins, an insane THIRTY TWO TIMES onto Steam... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of 8Floors's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] Argonauts Agency: Captive of Circe
[*] Argonauts Agency: Chair of Hephaestus
[*] Argonauts Agency: Glove of Midas
[*] Argonauts Agency: Golden Fleece
[*] Argonauts Agency: Missing Daughter
[*] Argonauts Agency: Pandora's Box
[*] Elven Rivers 2: New Horizons Collector's Edition
[*] Elven Rivers: The Forgotten Lands Collector's Edition
[*] Emergency Crew 2 Global Warming
[*] Emergency Crew Perfect Getaway Collector's Edition
[*] Emergency Crew Volcano Eruption
[*] Garden City
[*] Gnomes Garden
[*] Gnomes Garden 2
[*] Gnomes Garden 3: The thief of castles
[*] Gnomes Garden Lifeseeds Collector's Edition
[*] Gnomes Garden Lost King
[*] Gnomes Garden New Home
[*] Gnomes Garden: Christmas Story
[*] Gnomes Garden: Halloween
[*] Gnomes Garden: Return Of The Queen
[*] Lost Artifacts
[*] Lost Artifacts Mysterious Book Collector's Edition
[*] Lost Artifacts: Golden Island
[*] Lost Artifacts: Soulstone
[*] Lost Artifacts: Time Machine
[*] New Lands
[*] New Lands 2 Collector's Edition
[*] New Lands Paradise Island Collector's Edition
[*] Royal Roads
[*] Royal Roads 2 The Magic Box
[*] Royal Roads 3 Portal
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?  This valueless copy + paste garbage is taking up marketing space for genuine indie developers who are doing the right thing.  It's harmful to the industry and to gamers.

From a technical perspective, as a mobile app, this doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the mobile app or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this mobile app is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this mobile app will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality mobile phone graphics. 

The mobile app features simple, cartoony 2D graphics, of the type you normally expect to see in low effort mobile apps.  3D graphics programming does require a degree of skill and competence and unfortunately not all developers have the budget or talent to deliver this, despite 3D graphics cards hitting the mainstream in the 1990's.  Considering this is being evaluated as a PC game, having the graphics phoned in like this isn't going to result in a high quality, visually impressive game that PC gamers are used to seeing.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just iPhone screen tapping stuff.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

Because this is a mobile app, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the iPhones that the mobile app was designed for.  These are unfortunate handicaps and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was an afterthought for the iPhone developers who are to blame for this.  The mobile app is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for mobile phones forces upon a game.  Once more, mobile devs have made gaming worse for everyone.  I didn't spend thousands on building a gaming rig just so I could pretend it's an iPhone.

These technical defects push this mobile app below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Gnomes Garden didn't appeal much to the people who own a copy of the mobile app, either.  It has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the mobile app didn't really capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for clearing the first roadblock, which you can do in just a couple of taps on your iPhone screen, but only around 11 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the mobile app.  Hardly a success story, gamers just weren't all that interested in the mobile app.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this mobile app was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the mobile app.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show only 11 percent of players bothered playing the mobile app for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this mobile app to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the mobile app?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this mobile app for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the mobile app just has a couple of players every week running up the mobile app and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Once more we see greedy mobile devs trying to scam PC gamers. On Steam, this is $5 USD, on app stores, it's free. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay FIVE BUCKS FOR A FREE MOBILE APP just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.  This is unacceptable disrespect for PC gamers.  Because this can be played free elsewhere, and because of the other defects, it's impossible to recommend.  Who do they think we are?

author: {'steamid': '76561197962767542', 'num_games_owned': 3169, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1684413089}

review: [i]Gnomes Garden[/i] es un juego de estrategia que, sin ser complicado, reta al jugador en ciertas fases. Es una pena que sea corto, pero es divertido y adictivo, aunque tambiÃ©n permite dejarlo despuÃ©s de cada fase y por eso sirve para jugar en momentos perdidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1681942749}
review:
[h1] Gnome's Garden [/h1]
Collection game from 2015.

Construct buildings, remove obstacles, repair damaged bridges and restore the beauty of the royal garden. This is so in the first game of the series and has not lost its appeal to this day. From a technical point of view, not much has changed in this game principle to this day.

A well-made collecting game. And it is fun. There is an increasing difficulty tree, but it remains rather easy. The cards are well made, rather minimalistic, but therefore easy to overview. The annoying thieves don't steal in this early game, just nerf.
The story is more of a hook, but it fits the game.
New games have been coming out again and again for 8 years, and it will be the same again this year. That speaks for the popularity of the game.
I can recommend it.

My group and my archive with over 5,400 reviews here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

author: {'steamid': '76561198218778279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1674081597}
review:
For starters - I've played this game in a weird order, starting from the last part and ending it with the first one. 
I recommend the other two - Gnomes Garden 2 and 3 are great, but this one is lacking. 

The graphics are less pleasant, the gremlins are more annoying and the level difficulty is straight up weird. I've had some issues with this instalment compared to the latter parts that I've enjoyed thoroughly. I wish they would change some things up instad of recycling the same game three times, but that's it. 

Get gnomed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198875012018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1669386577}
review: It's neither a strategy game, nor a puzzle, nor a fun idler. Is it even a game? I don't know. You just click on everything around until the pointless tasks are crossed out from the list, and that's it. Oh, and the dumbest thing is that you have to wait for your workers to return to the base after EVERY SINGLE TASK they do. This is nothing but an annoying gimmick, added as an excuse to have time limits and three star ratings on each level, which don't suit this game at all. Alright, maybe there's at least some "exciting plot"? The trailer mentions it, right? Haha, don't even get me started on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089055572', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1665870439}
review: This game is okay if you enjoy mobile-esk games with rating and levels. It's the kind of shit your mom would play- but has 300 levels instead of a mere 49. For what it is, and what it was designed to do, it's okay. Definitely not my kind of game, but if you enjoy facebook era games, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026181605', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1661042266}
review:
6/10 - I enjoyed the Gnomes Garden series (GG, GG2, GG3) The time-management puzzles are childishly simple for the most part, but with a very few diabolical, random levels that will require multiple runs before getting the 3-Star rating for that level.

No, there is nothing particularly new and different here, when compared to other time-management games, and the story is a bit weak and lacking in charm IMHO. But seriously, this genre is not to be taken too seriously, since they are basically relaxing games to pass idle time.
I would recommend giving the series a go, but only if you pick it up on DEEP discount (90% Off), as I did. 100% Achievements are guaranteed, and the trading cards are a bonus. Cheers

author: {'steamid': '76561198409581145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1703562638}
review: If you are bored and just want something to do, this is the game for you. It seem like an easy game to play, however, you must have some type of plan,  if you wishes to get all three stars. Some I was able to get fairly easy, some I had to replay one time, and some it took me a while to even get two stars. I do enjoy playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141249123', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3292, 'last_played': 1648666149}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016306088', 'num_games_owned': 2068, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1645951955}
review: I grabbed this on sale in the collection and while the story wasn't really there the puzzle aspect was fun, this was a fantastic break from Elden Ring which had me frustrated. Could also easily play while watching my friend stream. Think there was two levels that I had to replay a few times to get my 3 stars I just had the timing off by a second which was frustrating. It's not something I would replay though and I left the game running quite a bit while I walked off, my actual game time was much less. Not sure it's value is there individually but certainly in the bundles its worthwhile. Can 100% the achievements with one playthrough just make sure you get 3 stars on every level.

[In English] - Translation to help my foreign friends understand

[h1] The basics of strategy games[/h1]

It is a strategy game that uses workers, Wizard, 
and guards to remove and repair various obstacles to achieve stage goals.
Usually, you need to upgrade where the resources are produced to an appropriate level. 
There are stages that can only be cleared by upgrading the base of workers 
or wizards to increase production.
In addition, there are active skills that increase movement speed for a certain period of time, 
shorten construction time, and stop time.

[b][u]â–² Pros[/u][/b]
- Uncomplicated strategy game
- Games with high cost performance (90% sale often)

[b][u]â–² Cons[/u][/b]
- Requires slightly longer playtime.(not meant to be terribly boring).

[b][u]â–² Overall review[/u][/b]
- I thought this game was really difficult until the first 15 stages or so. 
  But if you play it over and over again, you get used to it. 
  Once you get the time stop skill, it's easy from then on.
- There are a few series, but there are also reviews that the rest have a lot of bugs. 
  I recommend purchasing only 'Gnomes Garden 1,2,3'.[/b]

review: Got this for my seven-year-old who is fascinated by management sims.  It's a pretty gentle and engaging introduction to the genre, which a fair difficulty ramp in the later levels.  The gameplay is a little mobile-like, but it works as a casual title.

author: {'steamid': '76561199086098585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1627485372}
review:
[h3]Gnomes Garden[/h3]
[u]Zeitmanagement[/u]

Ein heiÃŸer Sommer lieÃŸ den wunderschÃ¶nen Garten des KÃ¶nigs vertrocknen. Als auch der KÃ¶nig selbst erkrankt, ist das Reich in Gefahr. Jetzt liegt es an Dir, die Rettung zu bringen - fÃ¼r den KÃ¶nig und den Garten.

Der erste Teil der Serie "Gnomes Garden" von 2015 sieht auch nach 6 Jahren noch zeitgemÃ¤ÃŸ hÃ¼bsch aus. Die Musik im Hintergrund ist angenehm frÃ¶hlich und lÃ¤sst sich eine Weile anhÃ¶ren. In gewohnter Manier darfst Du etappenweise alles reparieren, was zu reparieren ist. Dazu schickst Du zunÃ¤chst einen Arbeiter los, um Ressourcen zu sammeln: Nahrung, Holz, Steine und magische Kristalle. SpÃ¤ter wird es notwendig sein, die Anzahl der Arbeiter zu erhÃ¶hen, indem Du deren Haus erweiterst.

Da die eingesammelten Ressourcen nicht ersetzt werden, heiÃŸt es: baue SÃ¤gemÃ¼hlen, SteinbrÃ¼che usw. - dafÃ¼r ist das einsammelbare Material gedacht. SpÃ¤ter kommen noch weitere GebÃ¤ude dazu, die die nÃ¶tigen Ressourcen herstellen kÃ¶nnen. Um die Produktion zu beschleunigen, kannst Du die meisten GebÃ¤ude verbessern, was erst einmal Ressourcen kostet, sich aber in lÃ¤ngeren Runden immer lohnt.
Manche GebÃ¤ude "produzieren" Leute wie den Feuerwehrmann, der in bestimmten Runden gleich zwei Aufgaben hat. Lass Dich Ã¼berraschen, welche Charaktere Dir noch zur VerfÃ¼gung stehen und was diese zu erledigen haben. Und kleine nervige, grÃ¼ne Goblins werden Dich auch noch Ã¤rgern...

Zum Erringen von maximal 3 goldenen Sternen musst Du die Runde innerhalb einer bestimmten Zeit schaffen. Je weiter die Zeit ablÃ¤uft, umso weniger Sterne erhÃ¤ltst Du. Die Sterne haben am Ende nur fÃ¼r die TrophÃ¤en/Errungenschaften Bedeutung, Du kannst die Runde immer zu Ende spielen, auch wenn die Zeit fÃ¼r Sterne abgelaufen ist. 

Anders als in manch anderen verwandten Spielen kannst Du keinen Fehler machen, indem Du eine aufgesammelte Ressource am falschen Platz verbaust und Dir dann diese Ressource fehlt, um an anderer Stelle weiter zu kommen. Das bedeutet, Du musst den Ablauf nicht genau planen, sondern kannst einfach drauflos spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994030475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1625256674}
review: Sometimes you just need a casual click game that you can pick and put down in 10-15 minute increments. This game hits the spot. It is easy to pick up, casual, and just lets go with the flow with simple point and click. No fancy keyboard commands or powerful graphics card needed.  But wait....achievements for getting a perfect score on each level?  Oh. Now it's on.  Must stress out on each level and get max score.  (but not to worry - they aren't very hard - a few try to trick you into making/clearing stuff you don't need and once you figure that out, max score is easy.) Never had the game crash or glitch out.  And had a few levels where I could get myself stuck - tricky developers.  But it was only two or three levels - nothing to scare anyone off. Off to buy the extra levels while my wonderful wife shoots me daggers for finishing the game before her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255454319', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1601607025}
review: I love this game straight away when I just played the first level. The graphics are so beautiful. Iâ€™m a fan of Labor of Hercules but this game is better than the Hercules. This game is smoother, and the characters move faster and better. When a worker finished working at the current task and the resources are sufficient, I can have the other worker to work on other objective. In Hercules game, the first worker needs to go back to the house with the resources, then I only can move the second worker to do his task. Also, I can direct the worker to work the nearby task immediately whereas in Hercules, the worker needs to return to the house first.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1600593399}
review:
Annoying time management game.

It's annoying me because it has a) a speedup button that you need to remember to use in some levels to beat the 3-star time, b) jesters that come and stop your workers from working. That means I have two mechanisms outside of time management that just exist to make my life more difficult and to suck the enjoyment out of the game for me. There are other games (and better time management games) for me to have to put up with this.
This game has sequels (GG3 is on sale right now), but based on how my experience with 1 went (uninstalled when I reached the second area with the ice), I'm not interested any more.

Recommended if you like random guys annoying your workers and, by extension, you. I don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992758651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1690587781}
review:
First of all, this is a really good game, and I think that it's got a lot of potential but there are some tweaks that I would add, like a home base/camp, a button to turn off worker sounds, more resources, expansion, and some minor details that I'll get to later on. THIS IS ALL A SUGGESTION you won't make me feel bad if you don't read or use any of this.

1. A Camp
If there's one thing I noticed when playing the game is that it gets pretty repetitive and by that I mean having to start over again and again can get pretty annoying. But I have a solution! you can give a chance for players to build their own garden that doesn't reset like a camp and you might think well it might get a little to over powered of they are able to constantly farm resources and build what ever they want done whenever they feel like it well you can make it so you can make things in your kingdom cost more to build and you could have a level bar too which can indicate what you can unlock like having to be at a certain level in order to unlock: better upgrades, better workers, more buildings, and points that can let you expand or can let you get special items that can boost your farms/resource collectors.

2. A Button That Turns Off Worker Sounds
This one may not be essential for gameplay but can be annoying to some players so it could be nice to be able to turn that off. 

3. More Resources
It would be nice to have resources that you can turn into other resources like raw stone could turn into cut stone using  a stone-cutter which then could then turn into stone bricks which you could then use with planks that you got from converting wood to create walls(decorative). Plus there could be a more mining options like there could be ways to click on random geodes(It could look like a boulder with the mineral sticking out of it) that are scattered across the map that are scattered across the map or if you upgrade you quarry to the second last level then you can upgrade it again with gems which ultimately gives you a 1 out of 50 chance of getting 1 gem from your quarry.

4. Expansion
All of this could be a DLC that you buy for the game and this could be included
Expansion just means that as you level up you unlock more areas(or you can use resources to do that) and by doing that you give the player more space to build.

5. Gems
Gems can be payed with real money or can be earned from completing quests(more on that later) and could help: pay for resources you don't have, pay for something to speed up help you unlock buildings, and/or trade them withe the shopkeeper/traveling trader.

6. Friends
By adding a friends list you could add a friend to see their kingdom.

7. Shops 
You could add Shops so players can be able to trade goods for gems!

8. Quests 
you could add quests so that players have something they're trying to complete for gems, goods and building blueprints.

9.END 
That's all that I think would be great to add.

hopefully someone nice 
-Robo

review: This is not a good game. First of all, it does not play comfortable because sometimes you click on a resource, but the game updates the nearby building instead, these kinds of annoyances happen very often, when two things are close to each other. The difficulty is unbalanced, objectives are kind of random, levels look all the same for me. It is boring, I really did not like this game and will stick with Hercules series which is far better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017426654', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1594565579}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043779604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1593205271}
review:
Very basic resource management game.
49 levels, in each level you start with one worker and have to collect resources, construct buildings such as quarry / mine / mill that periodically produce resources. You can use these resources to upgrade buildings and achieve the level objectives.

Game is not very difficult, although I had to retry a few levels to get 3-star rating. Once you unlock the 3rd spell game becomes quite easy and a bit of a grind as there are no new mechanics introduced after.
Game is relatively fast paced.

Game length: around 6-7 hours. Not much replay value once it's finished.

Maybe something more suitable for young kids. There is no violence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025829386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1590375523}
review: I first played Gnomes Garden back in 2016 and it is still as fun to play now as it was then. The levels aren't impossible, but they can be tricky especially if you don't read the requirements to complete the level. There are extras included that you don't need to do to complete the level so you have to watch out for those.  I'm not a fast player so this took a few hours to complete but I enjoyed it. It's different from the more current releases in the series, but just as enjoyable. There are in game trophies as well as Steam achievements. Fun game and glad I played it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1589021062}
review:
It's a bit dated compared to more recent games in the same series, or from others in the same genre. But the only really annoying aspect was being unable to cancel an action after starting it which created some issues. 

And the last 1/4th of the game was super easy compared to the previous section of levels so the difficulty curve [at least for 3-stars] is a bit wonky. But if you enjoy time management games, it's a decent choice. Though, for the full price maybe not. I got it on sale for less than $1 and it was well worth that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072697950', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1705791810}
review:
Schade, ich war der Meinung, am Anfang der Levels konnte man zwischen Experte oder Entspannt aussuchen. 
Da ich erstmal die Herausforderung genommen hab und damit Schwierigkeiten hab, mÃ¶chte ich nun mal gerne die Entspannte Variante spielen. aber das geht irgendwie nicht und dadrÃ¼ber bin ich nun sehr enttÃ¤uscht, dass man das nicht mehr wechseln kann !  : (

author: {'steamid': '76561198034217728', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1583735685}
review: Cute game for the sale price, however some of the levels are bugged or just bad by design... it doesnt give you enough resources to finish the level if you take a different route then the one they "want" you to. I give it a three out of five though its okay =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033910034', 'num_games_owned': 3900, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1567870755}
review:
Recommended for those who enjoy casual time management games.

This a standard casual time management game with a little bit of story. It is quite polished and has moments where you are faced with a mild challenge. The graphics are cute and everything seems to fit nicely together. If these are your type of games, then this will add nicely to the collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844603465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1579896008}
review: Gioco molto semplice, lo consiglierei a chi piace questo tipo di giochi e non pretende una grafica molto superba.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020148836', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1578554827}
review:
A simple time management / strategy game, suitable for all ages.
All levels could be completed, replays happen on some to get the hang of it.
Visuals feel nice, despite didn't at first.

The publisher releases a bunch of very similar games, pick up those that are cheap (-90% usually) & thematically attractive. Can think about the others as additional levels if you want. Hence, no need to replay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014948162', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3378, 'last_played': 1578453720}
review: Great game to kill time with :D Lots of fun and a basic story but it makes you want to complete it! Worth it for a few bucks for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019263178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1578500014}
review: It's fun and challenging. Not monotonous like some other games like this. I enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974836738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1578186315}
review: I had a great time with this game.  I wasn't sure what it even was until I actually started to play, but it immediately pulled me in and I appreciated it for its simplistic, relaxing gameplay and the visual style.  The game gets a lot easier (which I appreciated) once you gain the ability to temporarily stop the timer, so I didn't have to replay any of the stages to get 3 stars after that point.  Replaying some of the earlier stages for 3 stars was sometimes frustrating, but my enjoyment of the gameplay meant that it was never torture.  Good stuff!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009503230', 'num_games_owned': 1768, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1537364171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268194016', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1570808318}
review:
Este es el tÃ­pico juego de.. te dan una zona destruida y llena de recursos esparcidos por todas partes que no te dejan avanzar por los caminos y al mismo tiempo que limpias los recursos y los acumulas tambiÃ©n construyes estructuras que te dan mÃ¡s de esos recursos para avanzar en el juego. 

Hay un total de 49 niveles y cada nivel tiene un tiempo determinado para completarse, conforme va restÃ¡ndose el tiempo en "X" momento se van restando estrellas, esto hace que puedas tener todas las estrellas o no al final del juego.

AdemÃ¡s de esto cada nivel tiene unos objetivos a completar durante el tiempo de la partida

Cada nivel tiene diferente dificultad, a mas nivel mas cosas que hacer, pero he de decir que hubo niveles bajos que me costaron mÃ¡s que otros de mayor nivel, sobretodo porque querÃ­a terminar el juego con todos los logros.

La historia del juego es sÃºper bÃ¡sica y superficial para poner en contexto al jugador sobre lo que estÃ¡ jugando y que no sea entrar hacer esto y ya estÃ¡.

No es un juego difÃ­cil ni largo, pero es muy entretenido para hecharle unas horillas. Es mejor pillarlo de oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045390257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1563750347}
review: Tough to say whether to recommend or not. Starts off with interesting concept and a few levels where timing is actually pretty tricky and things are added. But then the game adds nothing for the the 2nd half. Like nothing at all, but it provides a way to slow time to make it even easier. Once you figure out how to solve one stage, you can solve every stage the same way. So at full price (even $4.99) this isn't worth it unless you're under 10. I think my son would struggle with some stages. If you want to kill a few hours and it's 90% off, then worth it--but maybe the sequels are better than this / more challenging. Granted, I knew it would be easy and took the chance anyway. Recommending if you get this in a massive sale. A little more work from the devs could have made this a much better experience.

review: Anfangs war ich von dem Game Ã¼berzeugt, aber das 15. Level bzw Kapital 2, Level 3 hat mich endgÃ¼ltig aufgeregt. Man hat anfangs nur einen Garten als Nahrungsquelle, um zur MÃ¼hle (Nahrungsproduktion) zu gelangen, muss eine BrÃ¼cke errichtet werden, deren Bau (u.a.) Steine benÃ¶tigt. Diese Steine zu bekommen, ist hanebÃ¼chen. Wenn man sich zum Steinbruch vorarbeitet, spawnen diese nervigen SpaÃŸmacher (verwirren die Arbeiter), was einen dazu zwingt, das Feuerwehrhaus zu bauen (FeuerwehrmÃ¤nner vertreiben diese). Der Bau dieses Feuerwehrhauses nimmt uns aber die Steine. AuÃŸerdem gibt es einen zweiten Garten als Nahrungsquelle, um dorthin zu gelangen, muss ein Loch gefÃ¼llt werden, was auch wieder Steine benÃ¶tigt. author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1562390406}
review:
Cute easy game.
Levels would be challenging for younger players and those who have trouble concentrating or planning.

Pros:
- Each level lets you take as long as you want/need, despite the timer.
- The tutorial is very effective.
- Despite not being a proper puzzle game some levels do require levels of strategic planning, as well as a little luck.
- You can continue on with the story regardless of how many stars you earned for the previous levels, as long as you finish the level before moving on to the next.
- You can pause and restart levels whenever you want, and you can replay levels whenever you want.

Cons:
- This particular version of Gnomes Garden has no ability to cancel an action once you've put it into the queue.
- Young players will find it frustrating or impossible to try and achieve 3 stars on every level.
- I was unable to wipe my progress or start again under another player's name, meaning that once you've finished it once, your scores stay in place (but you can still play all of the levels again).

author: {'steamid': '76561198140026354', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1547761539}
review:
Gnomes Garden Ã¨ un gioco Strategico di tipo Manageriale a Tempo ad ambientazione Fantasy.



Â» Storia - 2/5
Storia veramente, ma veramente semplice: sei la principessa del tuo regno e vuoi restaurare "il giardino del regno" in seguito alla malattia di tuo padre perchÃ© le due cose son collegate.

Â» Musica e Grafica - 3/5
Per quanto riguarda entrambi non c'Ã¨ molto da dire: nessuna delle due Ã¨ eccezionale o particolare. La musica si sente che Ã¨ fatta bene nonostante la ripetitivitÃ , mentre la grafica non merita nulla piÃ¹ della sufficienza

Â» Controlli - 3/5
Allora, in realtÃ  il voto basso non Ã¨ per i controlli, i controlli sono ok (fai tutto con un clic del mouse) il vero problema sono i comandi che dai agli gnomi. Il gioco funziona cosÃ¬: dai uno o piÃ¹ comandi in coda ai personaggi fino al completamento del livello, il problema Ã¨ proprio la coda perchÃ© i personaggi non hanno intelligenza artificiale quindi se pensate di raccogliere un oggetto lungo strada mentre il vostro gnomo torna dopo aver costruito una cosa non sarÃ  mai cosÃ¬, anzi, tornerÃ  al suo posto e poi andrÃ  a raccogliere. PuÃ² essere frustrante se volete prendere tutti gli achievement e completare un livello entro il tempo limite per le 3 stelle

Â» Achievement
Tutto sommato semplici da fare, basta completare il gioco al 100%.

Â» Considerazioni Personali
Mi sento di consigliare questo gioco nonostante la sua mediocritÃ  perchÃ© Ã¨ comunque piÃ¹ che sufficiente per passare il tempo con dei "rompicapi" o se volete solo accumulare giochi da completare al 100% senza troppa fatica.
Consigliato soprattutto quando scontato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164871081', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 839, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1555938805}
review:
Cute time management game, pretty simple but if you go for three stars on every level it can be pretty time consuming if you don't go in with a good strategy ahead of time. I really enjoyed this game. Got it on sale and it was worth it. Exactly the type of game I was looking for.

All achievements were unlocked after around 14 hours- was a wonderful game! Bought the next few in the bundle as well :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1539352974}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

Approximate amount of time to 100%: 7,5h
Estimated achievement difficulty: 4/10
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 1, level selection
Has it been in a bundle: Yes
Is there a good guide available: You don't need a guide
How many people have complete this game at the time I'm writing this review: 193 on Astats

Multiplayer achievements: No
Missable achievements: No
Grinding Achievements: No
DLC-Only achievements: No
Time-gated achievements: No
RNG-achievements: No
Does difficulty affect achievements: No
Unobtainable/glitched achievements: No

This is a simple but fun time management game. I had some troubles with getting 3 stars on some snow levels, but after I beat the game it was already a bit easier.  The achievements are very straight forward, the only one to keep in mind is getting 3 stars on every level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211749000', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1539046103}
review:
Cute time management game, pretty simple but if you go for three stars on every level it can be pretty time consuming if you don't go in with a good strategy ahead of time. I really enjoyed this game. Got it on sale and it was worth it. Exactly the type of game I was looking for.

All achievements were unlocked after around 14 hours- was a wonderful game! Bought the next few in the bundle as well :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005663668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1631038034}
review: Great little cute game, nice and simple and fun for about 15 hours.  If they had some sort of award/xp system it might have some replayability but as it is now I don't think i'll revisit but it was defnitely a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198403082919', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1533870868}
review:
The game is not so boring as some players said (maybe just because I've never played this kind of game before). 
Actually it's interesting, and the difficulty is decent,  the price is fair as well (though I got this game for free LOL). 
I think the only problem of this game is that the screen is a little bit too vivid, which may make your eyes feel tired after a long-time playing, but it's still acceptable.
In a word, this game is worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045005161', 'num_games_owned': 1913, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1526813407}
review:
A fun and easy to learn and play time management game with gnomes, firemen and sorceresses. It is a very relaxing casual game, with just the right amount of challenges. With each level you have to complete certain tasks which get more difficult the further you progress in the levels. The little gnomes help you gather resources, build structures and upgrade them. You will also get bonus power ups like faster running or building, which will help you in your strategy to complete the level with 3 stars. 

This is the first game of the Gnomes Garden series. Some levels are pretty challenging if you want to get the 3 stars achievement. 

The Good:
+ 40+ levels
+ Fun casual gameplay
+ Good music
+ Nice looking graphics
+ Achievements
+ Steam cards

The Bad:
- Could use various difficulty settings
- No difficulty modes

15 minutes of gameplay with no commentary to get a good impression of the game:
https://youtu.be/Pb1VZRmlbl0

author: {'steamid': '76561198008632502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1525110556}
review:
This was a fun puzzle game which I completed with all 3 star levels in 10 hours. No violence, and the levels gradaully get a bit more tricky each time. The game is simple to master and is all point and click to send your minions off to get on with their business. I would imagine that this was developed as a smart phone game, which is to take nothing away from it. 
I found it an enjoyable little diversion from "big" games like Skyrim, and is something which you can dip in and out of. 
Levels are timed for star rewards.
I got it for 39p on Steam sale, and it is certainly worth that!
For a little puzzler I bought cheap on a whim, I am very pleased with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1524685144}
review:
"Gnomes Garden" ist ein Time-Management Gelegenheitsspiel.

Ein schÃ¶ner Garten ist immer wichtig, gerade fÃ¼r eine Prinzessin. Dumm nur, daÃŸ ein besonders trockener Sommer unserem Garten arg zugesetzt hat. Also gilt es, Pflanzensamen zu sammeln, um den Garten wieder neu erblÃ¼hen zu lassen. Allerdings ist das nicht so einfach. BaumstÃ¤mme oder schlafende Steinriesen versperren die Wege. Um letztere aufzuwecken bedarf es einer Fee. Um die zu bekommen braucht es ein Feehaus und auch magische Steine mÃ¼ssen produziert werden, damit die Fee arbeiten kann. FÃ¼r den Steinbruch braucht es unter anderem Steine. Zum Aufbau des Steinbruchs brauchts Holz, dafÃ¼r brauchts ein SÃ¤gewerk und dafÃ¼r brauchts ne BÃ¤ckerei. Und so hÃ¤ngt denn genretypisch alles von vielem ab und wir mÃ¼ssen praktisch alles auf den 49 Screens wegrÃ¤umen und aufbauen, um den Level zu gewinnen.  

Das ist aber auch ein Problem des Spieles, denn auch wenn es technisch funktioniert und insgesamt recht nett gemacht ist. Es fehlt an Abwechslung. Die Level sind meist Ã¤hnlich aufgebaut, man geht auch fast immer Ã¤hnlich vor. Richtige Herausforderung gibt es nicht. 

Und so ist das Game denn ein ganz netter Zeitkiller, mehr aber auch nicht und so einige Genrekollegen machen denn doch eine spannendere Figur.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
6/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
4/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Netter aber eintÃ¶niger Zeitkiller.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1524117892}
review:
Gnomes garden is a time management project series (four so far) collaborated through a London based company https://www.facebook.com/8FloorGames and a polish one http://www.creobit.pl/ . It's in similar vain to the 'Hercules' or the 'Moai' time management series.

Apparently the king had a beautiful garden which quickly withered in a nasty summer heat wave. The thought of which made the King enter into a black incurable depression. The only hope left is for the princess to venture forth throughout the 49 levelled kingdom collecting seeds from 7 magical trees and bring them back to the castle and finally celebrate your victory with a gnome ACDC concert.

The biggest gripe with players is the level of difficulty for those that want to 100% this with three stars and unlock all 23 achievements. Some levels are really difficult. For instance, one woman claimed she was at a level for 2 hours and still couldn't pass it. Personally I had trouble with 6 of them, out of which I would not have been able to work out and pass by myself, if it wasn't for the accommodating Steam video guide that someone has taken time to produce. Thankfully with his guide I was able to pass the game 100% while keeping my temper in the realms of not needing to be detained by police.

Unfortunately if you make a mistake and upgrade some buildings that you did not mean to, you can't right click it and stop the upgrade, also there is no numbering system which shows you the order in which the gnome workers are attending to the tasks you have set out. Which are usually two handy tools which those that play these click fest games love using.

In final, if you like to pull your hair out when you see that third star fade away just before you are at the brink of completing the last task. If you enjoy shouting expletives to never ending little green boogers that parade around your screen clobbering your worker gnomes. If you enjoy the physical exercise of trying to break your computer chair over your knee only to succumb to throwing it at your monitor when you realise that your upgrading something you donâ€™t need to and donâ€™t have enough resources of what you do need. Believe me when I say this, this is the game for you.

One of the hardest levels as a sample for you...

https://youtu.be/-ooTaUHOfDk

If you enjoyed reading this review feel free to subscribe to my curator page. Thanks...

http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6843548/

author: {'steamid': '76561198287649491', 'num_games_owned': 1169, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1521376588}
review:
This casual strategy game features 50 levels. The first 15 are exciting as they introduce many new elements. The difficulty is going up in each level where previous trick in one level cannot be applied to new level, to get all 3 starts. 
After the third power up, the game goes into easy mode, and the rest of the game is just grinding chore. At least, the final level is a fun relief.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1495300381}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Gnomes Garden" is a Strategy game. The game was developed by Workroom 7 and published by 8 Floor Games.

"Gnomes Garden" is the first episode of Gnomes Garden."

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are no difficulty game modes to choose from. All levels has their own difficulty.

This is a strategy game, where careful planning is required, due to the limited amount of resources that are available.

There are four different landmasses with the total of forty-nine levels. Each of the levels has their own objectives that need to be completed.

Tasks objects can be chained together. Only if there is nothing in the way and/or enough resource material in the storage bins.

All levels have a total of three stars to be earned. The stars represent how fast the level is completed. Replaying the levels can help improve the amount of stars that has been earned.

There are special bonuses in the game to help complete the level much quicker. All the bonuses come with a time limit but they can be reactivated once their bar has filled.

There are twenty-four different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are five different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039137828', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1511296163}
review:
[h1] Gnomes Garden von Workroom7 und Creobit [/h1]

Ein kurzes Spiel fÃ¼r Zwischendurch, bei welchem sich jeder 12 Labours of Hercules Spieler sofort heimisch fÃ¼hlen dÃ¼rfte.

[b][i]Story & Gameplay[/i][/b]

Die Handlung ist recht simpel. Dein Vater, der KÃ¶nig, ist krank geworden und sein wunderschÃ¶ner Garten verwelkt. Um ihn wieder aufzupÃ¤ppeln, ziehst du als mutige Prinzessin los um neue Pflanzen aufzutreiben. 
Um an diese Pflanzen heran zu kommen reist die Prinzessin durch verschiedene Gebiete, lÃ¤sst ihre fleiÃŸigen Arbeiter Materialien (Nahrung, Holz, Stein und Kristalle) einsammeln. Damit kÃ¶nnen diese dann GebÃ¤ude bauen oder verbessern, Hindernisse bei Seite schaffen und vieles mehr. 
Auf diese Art darf man sich durch 49 Level klickern, denn gesteuert wird komplett mit der linken Maustaste. Im Verlauf des Spieles kommen dann noch 3 FÃ¤higkeiten hinzu:
1. schneller Laufen,
2. schneller arbeiten,
3. Timer anhalten.
Der Timer ist aber nicht wirklich wichtig, er legt lediglich fest, wie viele der 3 mÃ¶glichen Sterne man nach dem Abschluss der jeweiligen Mission erhÃ¤lt. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist durchwachsen, manche Level sind recht leicht, andere sind schwerer, sodass fÃ¼r jeden etwas dabei sein dÃ¼rfte.
Es ist auch mÃ¶glich zu â€verlierenâ€œ, also Steckenzubleiben. Dies passiert. wenn man die Ressourcen in der falschen Reihenfolge einsammelt oder das falsche MaterialgebÃ¤ude zuerst baut. Ein klein wenig StrategieverstÃ¤ndnis und vorausplanendes denken kann also nicht schaden. 

[b][i]Grafik & Sound[/i][/b]

Die putzige Cartoongrafik passt in meinen Augen sehr gut zum Spiel. Die Figuren sehen niedlich aus und die Karten und GebÃ¤ude sind liebevoll designt.
Die Musik dudelt recht belanglos im Hintergrund ohne wirklich aufzufallen, dementsprechend gibt es dazu auch nicht viel zu sagen.

[b][i]Fazit[/i][/b]

Wer Spiele dieser Art mag, macht hier definitiv nichts verkehrt. Wer die 12 Labours of Hercules Reihe gut fand sollte hier auf jeden Fall mal einen Blick drauf werfen. Auch die ErfolgsjÃ¤ger sollten sich Gnomes Garden einmal zu GemÃ¼te fÃ¼hren, denn alle Achivements sind leicht zu bekommen. Das einzige wirkliche Manko ist in meinen Augen der Preis. Dieser liegt bei aktuell 6â‚¬, was ich fÃ¼r 5-8 Stunden Spielzeit recht hoch finde, zumal andere Spiele dieser Art deutlich gÃ¼nstiger zu bekommen sind. Wartet am besten auf einen Sale und schlagt zu wenn der Preis bei 1-2â‚¬ liegt.


[quote]Wenn euch die Review gefallen/geholfen hat dann folgt doch unserem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8049466/] Reviewprogramm[/url] und wenn ihr mir etwas zu dieser Review mitteilen wollt dann schreibt gerne in die Kommentare.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044913888', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1504137208}
review:
Good time management game.  Not super-easy, but not super-hard.  I had to replay maybe 40% of the levels to get 100%.  Kids enjoyed the graphics and sound.

I hear Gnomes Garden 2 is easier, so if you want a better challenge, try the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012507724', 'num_games_owned': 1865, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1502839531}
review:
If you've played these games before, you know pretty much what to expect and this game delivers all that. Click the resources, click the buildings, complete the objectives -- and try to do it on time.

Bad things about this game: 
* You can't undo actions, no matter how much you want to
* Tooltips are occasionally slow
* Storyline is absolutely barebones... it might as well not even exist
* Difficulty of getting 3 stars severely drops mid and late game once you get time stop

None of these things stopped me from enjoying the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996744560', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1500370166}

A nice little resource management game with 50 levels. 
It takes about 5-6 hours to complete the game. 
Good casual fun with decent graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058584412', 'num_games_owned': 9611, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1491583597}
review: I have a soft spot in my heart for time management games like this.  This one is pretty good, though it's also one of the easier ones I've ever played.  There are a few levels where if you aren't looking ahead to what you'll ultimately need, you'll get to near the end and spend a lot of time waiting.  But the next time you do the level, it'll become easy once you switch your strategy up a little to accomodate the end of the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1463245602}
review:
[h1]Short version: 62%[/h1]
While there is nothing inherently wrong with Gnomes Garden, it is simply just decent time management game that you will most likely forget five minutes after finishing it.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Gnomes Garden is a typical casual time/resource management game: you have 1-3 workers, whose task is to gather resources (food, wood, stone, and crystals) to spend on production facilities and on clearing road obstacles that prevent you from reaching the end of the stage.
Problem is, the developers knew how the core mechanics of such a game work, but they had serious issues with the details. All gameplay elements are introduced in the starting stages, leaving nothing than endless repetition for the majority of its 49 levels. At least reaching gold times on them is a challenging task; maybe a bit too much, I regularly had about 1-3 seconds left on the clock.

Interestingly, the game uses 3D models, meaning it is more demanding than most titles in this genre. But that is not why it has such a mediocre score, but because it does absolutely nothing to stand out in the sea of similar time management games: there is next to no story, the atmosphere is generic fairy tale, the whole game isâ€¦ bland. Good enough for a casual game, but not even the least bit memorable.

review: Gnomes Garden is a time/resource management game simliar to the 12 Labours of Hercules, except dumbed down. It's a fun game, just not as detailed as the aforementioned game. There's an annoying little green guy who the fireman chases off, but if he catches you it causes confusion. If you like the genre, pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107378056', 'num_games_owned': 1517, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1466149289}
review:
TL:DR 7/10 casual click ordering

I enjoyed this for my 1st introduction to click-management.  There is no Difficulty setting.  Medium challenge throughout with a couple of harder levels before the midpoint.

Of course, I pursued and achieved the top 3Star rating for all levels, which gives all Achievements.  It probably took me about 6-8 hours.  Glance at the pathing in the beginning to plan a sensible route.  Use RunSpeedBoost button when available, but even more important is the HaltTime button whenever possible.  Rarely are you required to upgrade the resource building above Level1.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998832714', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1701877488}
review:
If you like time management games then you might give this one a try. There isn't much of a story really your just restoring the king's garden. Nothing fancy, really it's just remembering which buildings to upgrade and which not and in what order.

I got the game in a bundle so I didn't pay much for it. I probably would not reset and play all the way through again, at least not anytime soon but overall it was quite fun. I especially enjoyed the achievements which gave me something to work for. Aim high.. go for three stars before moving on to the next level!

What I liked, it's fast paced which makes it challenging. This game is definitely a family type game and safe for all ages. Having said that here is what I didn't like, because it's fast paced it probably a little too challenging for pre-teens or younger children. My one real complaint would be that I can't always stop the aggravating little gnomes that come out to bonk my workers. We're supposed to be able to click on them IF we have firemen built, well many times it simply doesn't work. Or if it does they still keep going disrupting my workers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142784767', 'num_games_owned': 1484, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1465437864}
review: It is very easy to beat the missions within the 3 star time.  There isn't much of a story; you are restoring the king's garden.  I got the game in a bundle and didn't pay much for it.  It didn't require as much strategy as other games like this I have played.  I still enjoyed going through all of the missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1461787113}
review:
The King felt ill! The kingdom seems in disarray! It's up to you, his daughter, to restore the kingdom to its former glory!

Like for 12 Labours of Hercules, the main character isn't helping at all. In other words, it's the servants that are doing all the work. Gnomes Garden is a casual time management game where you have workers that are gathering resources needed (food, wood, stone and crystals), building mines (for the stone and crystals), farms and windmills (for the food), workshop (for the wood), upgrading these for a better production and  repairing routes and other objectives (like light a fire or activate portals). However, the servants can be helped by witches (needed for some objectives) and firemen (helping objective plants to grow or to scare the little monster that will incapacitate your witch or servant from doing their jobs for a few seconds). And you'll repeat that  for 50 levels.

However, there are temporary bonus, regenerating over time, that can be activated : run faster (your minions move faster), work faster (less time for the building to give the resources) and stop time (the timer is frozen for a limited time). And these are very handy if you want to reach the three stars. Indeed, you have a timer. If you go past a star, you're loosing it. The less time you spent, the more likely you'll keep three stars. And as it's an achievement, you're also motivated. Nothing is wrong to loose one or two in the first run, so that you can try different strategies for the level. However, keep in mind that sometimes, you need to manage tightly your resources: you may be lacking some of them when they're needed and can't advance anymore (example: no more stones for a hole in the road - the building that could have given you the resource is behind this hole and there is no other road to it - you're doomed to restart). One of the good points is that you're not limited in the tasks done by the servant, if you want to gather 3 woods and 2 foods, you can check them without restriction (compared to 12 Labours of Hercules where you couldn't indicate more than 3 tasks).

As you can see, the gameplay isn't hard per se, it's just a matter of being efficient and to make the right choices (no need to upgrade a building to the maximum if the current level is sufficient or to upgrade the house - I've made the majority of the levels with two workers only). However, you don't have any other characters that can help. It's just the minions, not even the princess is present in the level to do something.

The graphics aren't bad in itself, they're cute, however, the HUD could have been more reflecting this and the list of objectives less confusing. The soundtrack was also good.

However, Gnomes Garden, while being still enjoyable, didn't have the same magic than 12 Labours of Hercules. You have more stuff to manage, true, but you can't choose your difficulty, the map is poorly designed and there, you don't have really any help from an heroin, contrary to Hercules and Megara, that were present and needed for some tasks. For the price, 12 Labours of Hercules proposes more fun for less money spent. But Gnomes Garden is still a good little game. Wait for a discount or for a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1458886253}
review:
https://youtu.be/J8anii1cuEI

When a blight hits the land and destroys all the gardens in the kingdom it's up to the princess to restore them back to their former glory.

A fine task to undertake but gameplay is relegated to clicking things as they pop up until you eventually win.  Later levels do ramp up the difficulty slightly by requiring optimal play to earn all three stars on a level.  Even with that added pressure the decision making for the player is minimal at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977460072', 'num_games_owned': 2579, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1455668569}
review:
Â¿Porque no lo recomiendo? La pregunta seria: Â¿Y porque recomendarlo? Basicamente es 12 Labours of Hercules pero demasiado mas simple, con algun nivel desquiciante. (Hay uno que aparecen continuamente enemigos y no te da ni un respiro, eso no es divertido, eso es agobiante). De duraciÃ³n no anda mal, entre 6 y 8 horas tirando para lo ultimo. Los niveles son muy monotonos, algunos me suenan a deja vu, la estructura del nivel es basicamente similar en la mayoria, y los cambios esteticos no favorecen (Arboles por palmeras.... que viejo truco)
No es malo pero del estilo los hay mejores, pillatelo si esta en un bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078672650', 'num_games_owned': 3299, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1455419969}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087834803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1460222345}
review:
Enjoyable time management game with some annoying technical issues.

Good level design with lots of renewable resources, so the strategy is mainly in figuring out when to build and upgrade production centers. Hard to get completely stuck, but sometimes challenging to get three stars. I missed getting three stars on about a third of the levels the first time around, and liked the game enough to want to go back and replay them.

Major downsides:

The sides are cut off in fullscreen mode on a 4:3 monitor, occasionally cutting off things you need to click on. It mostly works in windowed mode, but the resources needed tooltips are sometimes cut off, so you have to guess what you need, and the window's too small to play comfortably. (Or maybe I just need new glasses.)

A bug with the same achievement popping up every five seconds when I replayed levels after completing the game. Irritating enough to make the game unplayable unless I turn off the sound.

Clickable areas aren't well defined and are sometimes misaligned, so when objects are close together, it can be difficult to click on the right thing.

I had enough fun with the game to recommend it despite these issues, but they might be dealbreakers for someone else.

review: I really enjoyed this game. It's so simple yet fantastic, I can see potential expansions or sequels for it happening. The concept is very simple. Overall I found all but two levels to be fairly easy, however great way to pass some time. Hope they make more levels or another game with even more to do. By far one of my new favorite casual games.
